sentences.en: As an exercise in stating the obvious, this could scarcely be faulted.
sentences.cn: 这说的都是些显而易见的事情，几乎不可能出错。

sentences.en: Bruce had scarcely shaken our hands when the phone rang.
sentences.cn: 布鲁斯刚和我们握了握手，电话就响了。

sentences.en: He found the dullness of his work scarcely bearable.
sentences.cn: 他觉得他的工作枯燥乏味,简直无法忍受.

sentences.en: He had scarcely sat down when there was a knock at the door.
He scarcely ever left the region.
sentences.cn: 他几乎没有离开过这个地区。

sentences.en: He was scarcely more than a boy.
His style could scarcely be further removed from that of his predecessor.
sentences.cn: 他的风格几乎和他的前辈如出一辙。

sentences.en: In one ad the viewer scarcely sees the car's exterior.
sentences.cn: 在一则广告中，观众几乎看不到汽车的外观。

sentences.en: Scarcely had they left before soldiers arrived armed with rifles.
sentences.cn: 他们刚离开，扛着步枪的士兵们就到了。

sentences.en: Seeing such fine weather, the boys could scarcely keep in.
sentences.cn: 看到这样的好天气, 男孩们在屋里待不住了.

sentences.en: She scarcely earns enough money to make ends meet.
sentences.cn: 她几乎挣不到足够的钱以维持开支.

sentences.en: She was scarcely 18 when she made her debut.
Such an idea was scarcely thinkable ten years ago.
sentences.cn: 十年前，这样的想法几乎是难以想象的。

sentences.en: The city had scarcely changed in 20 years.
sentences.cn: 这座城市20年中几乎没有什么改变。

sentences.en: The country had scarcely any industry.
The difference is scarcely perceptible to the average reader.
sentences.cn: 这种差别一般读者几乎是察觉不到的.

sentences.en: Ultimately, Bismarck's revisionism scarcely affected or damaged British interests at all.
sentences.cn: 从根本上说，俾斯麦的修正主义几乎未对英国的利益造成一丝一毫的影响或损害。

words.tran_cn: 好容易才,几乎,模糊地,轻微地

trans.tran_cn: 几乎不，简直不，刚刚，才，决不，（刚）一…就
trans.tran_en: almost not or almost none at all
